Name: Phase On
Description: Set when NEMA Phase On becomes active, either upon start of green or walk interval, whichever occurs first.

Name: Phase Begin Green
Description: Set when either solid or flashing green indication has begun.  Do not set repeatedly during flashing operation.

Name: Phase Check
Description: Set when a conflicting call is registered against the active phase.   (Marks beginning of MAX timing)

Name: Phase Min Complete
Description: Set when phase min timer expires.

Name: Phase Gap Out
Description: Set when phase gaps out, but may not necessarily occur upon phase termination.  Event may be set multiple times within a single green under simultaneous gap out.

Name: Phase Max Out
Description: Set when phase MAX timer expires, but may not necessarily occur upon phase termination due to last car passage or other features.

Name: Phase Force Off
Description: Set when phase force off is applied to the active green phase.

Name: Phase Green Termination
Description: Set when phase green indications are terminated into either yellow clearance or permissive (FYA) movement.

Name: Phase Begin Yellow Clearance
Description: Set when phase yellow indication becomes active and clearance timer begins.

Name: Phase End Yellow Clearance
Description: Set when phase yellow indication become inactive.

Name: Phase Begin Red Clearance
Description: Set only if phase red clearance is served.  Set when red clearance timing begins.

Name: Phase End Red Clearance
Description: Set only if phase red clearance is served.  Set when red clearance timing concludes.   This may not necessarily coincide with completion of the phase, especially during clearance of trailing overlaps, red revert timing, red rest, or delay for other ring terminations.

Name: Phase Inactive
Description: Set when the phase is no longer active within the ring, including completion of any trailing overlaps or end of barrier delays for adjacent ring termination.

Name: Pedestrian Begin Walk
Description: Set when walk indication becomes active.

Name: Pedestrian Begin Clearance
Description: Set when flashing don’t walk indication becomes active.

Name: Pedestrian Begin Solid Don’t Walk
Description: Set when don’t walk indication becomes solid (non flashing) from either termination of ped clearance, or head illumination after a ped dark interval.

Name: Pedestrian Dark
Description: Set when the pedestrian outputs are set off.

Name: Barrier Termination
Description: Set when all active phases become inactive in the ring and cross barrier phases are next to be served.

Name: FYA – Begin Permissive
Description: Set when flashing yellow arrow becomes active.

Name: FYA – End Permissive
Description: Set when flashing yellow arrow becomes inactive through either clearance of the permissive movement or transition into a protected movement.

Name: Phase Hold Active
Description: Set when phase hold is applied by the coordinator, preemptor, or external logic.   Phase does not necessarily need to be actively timing for this event to occur.

Name: Phase Hold Released
Description: Set when phase hold is released by the coordinator, preemptor, or external logic.   Phase does not necessarily need to be actively timing for this event to occur.

Name: Phase Call Registered
Description: Call to service on a phase is registered by vehicular demand.   This event will not be set if a recall exists on the phase.

Name: Phase Call Dropped
Description: Call to service on a phase is cleared by either service of the phase or removal of call.

Name: Pedestrian Call Registered
Description: Call to service on a phase is registered by pedestrian demand.   This event will not be set if a recall exists on the phase.

Name: Phase Omit On
Description: Set when phase omit is applied by the coordinator, preemptor, or other dynamic sources.  Phase does not necessarily need to be actively timing for this event to occur.  This event is not set when phase is removed from the active sequence or other configuration-level change has occurred.

Name: Phase Omit Off
Description: Set when phase omit is released by the coordinator, preemptor, or other dynamic sources.  Phase does not necessarily need to be actively timing for this event to occur.  This event is not set when phase is added from the active sequence or other configuration-level change has occurred.

Name: Pedestrian Omit On
Description: Set when ped omit is applied by the coordinator, preemptor, or other dynamic sources.  Phase does not necessarily need to be actively timing for this event to occur.  This event is not set when phase is removed from the active sequence or other configuration-level change has occurred.

Name: Pedestrian Omit Off
Description: Set when ped omit is released by the coordinator, preemptor, or other dynamic sources.  Phase does not necessarily need to be actively timing for this event to occur.  This event is not set when phase is added from the active sequence or other configuration-level change has occurred.

Name: Overlap Begin Green
Description: Set when overlap becomes green. Do not set repeatedly when overlap is flashing green.   Note that overlap colors are consistent to the GYR intervals resultant from the controller programming and may not be indicative of actual signal head colors.

Name: Overlap Begin Trailing Green (Extension)
Description: Set when overlap is green and extension timers begin timing.

Name: Overlap Begin Yellow
Description: Set when overlap is in a yellow clearance state.   Note that overlaps which drive yellow field indications during a dwell state may be reported as green or inactive. (common to mid-block signals)

Name: Overlap Begin Red Clearance
Description: Set when overlap begins timing red clearance intervals.

Name: Overlap Off (Inactive with red indication)
Description: Set when overlap has completed all timing, allowing any conflicting phase next to begin service.

Name: Overlap Dark
Description: Set when overlap head is set dark (no active outputs).  The end of this interval shall be recorded by either an overlap off state or other active overlap state.

Name: Pedestrian Overlap Begin Walk
Description: Set when walk indication becomes active.

Name: Pedestrian Overlap Begin Clearance
Description: Set when flashing don’t walk indication becomes active.

Name: Pedestrian Overlap Begin Solid Don’t Walk
Description: Set when don’t walk indication becomes solid (non flashing) from either termination of ped clearance, or head illumination after a ped dark interval.

Name: Pedestrian Overlap Dark
Description: Set when the pedestrian outputs are set off.

Name: Detector Off
Description: Detector on and off events shall be triggered post any detector delay/extension processing.

Name: Detector On
Description: Detector on and off events shall be triggered post any detector delay/extension processing.

Name: Detector Restored
Description: Detector restored to non-failed state by either manual restoration or re-enabling via continued diagnostics.

Name: Detector Fault- Other
Description: Detector failure logged upon local controller diagnostics only (not system diagnostics).

Name: Detector Fault- Watchdog Fault
Description: Detector failure logged upon local controller diagnostics only (not system diagnostics).

Name: Detector Fault- Open Loop Fault
Description: Detector failure logged upon local controller diagnostics only (not system diagnostics).

Name: Detector Fault- Shorted Loop Fault
Description: Detector failure logged upon local controller diagnostics only (not system diagnostics).

Name: Detector Fault- Excessive Change Fault
Description: Detector failure logged upon local controller diagnostics only (not system diagnostics).

Name: PedDetector Off
Description: Ped detector events shall be triggered post any detector delay/extension processing and may be set multiple times for a single pedestrian call.   (with future intent to eventually support ped presence and volume)

Name: Pedestrian Detector Failed
Description: Detector failure logged upon local controller diagnostics only (not system diagnostics).

Name: Pedestrian Detector Restored
Description: Detector failure logged upon local controller diagnostics only (not system diagnostics).

Name: Preempt Advance Warning Input
Description: Set when preemption advance warning input is activated.

Name: Preempt (Call) Input On
Description: Set when preemption input is activated.   (prior to preemption delay timing)   May be set multiple times if input is intermittent during preemption service.

Name: Preempt Gate Down Input Received
Description: Set when gate down input is received by the controller (if available).

Name: Preempt (Call) Input Off
Description: Set when preemption input is de-activated.    May be set multiple times if input is intermittent preemption service.

Name: Preempt Entry Started
Description: Set when preemption delay expires and controller begins transition timing (force off) to serve preemption.

Name: Preemption Begin Track Clearance
Description: Set when track clearance phases are green and track clearance timing begins.

Name: Preemption Begin Dwell Service
Description: Set when preemption dwell or limited service begins or minimum dwell timer is reset due to call drop and reapplication.

Name: Preemption Link Active On
Description: Set when linked preemptor input is applied from active preemptor.

Name: Preemption Link Active Off
Description: Set when linked preemptor input is dropped from active preemptor.

Name: Preemption Max Presence Exceeded
Description: Set when preemption max presence timer is exceeded and preemption input is released from service.

Name: Preemption Begin Exit Interval
Description: Set when preemption exit interval phases are green and exit timing begins.

Name: TSP Check In
Description: Set when request for priority is received.

Name: TSP Adjustment to Early Green
Description: Set when controller is adjusting active cycle to accommodate early service to TSP phases.

Name: TSP Adjustment to Extend Green
Description: Set when controller is adjusting active cycle to accommodate extended service to TSP phases.

Name: TSP Check Out
Description: Set when request for priority is retracted.

Name: Coord Pattern Change
Description: Coordination pattern that is actively running in the controller.   (Highest priority of TOD, System or manual command).   This event will not be reapplied if coordination is temporarily suspended for preemption or other external control.

Name: Cycle Length Change
Description: This event shall be populated upon selection of a new coordination pattern change that selects a new cycle length.   Cycle lengths in excess of 255 shall record this event with a 255 parameter, requiring controller database lookup for this actual value.

Name: Offset Length Change
Description: This event shall be populated upon selection of a new coordination pattern change that selects a new cycle length.   Offsets in excess of 255 shall record this event with a 255 parameter, requiring controller database lookup for this actual value.

Name: Split 1 Change
Description: New Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Split 2 Change
Description: New Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Split 3 Change
Description: New Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Split 4 Change
Description: New Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Split 5 Change
Description: New Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Split 6 Change
Description: New Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Split 7 Change
Description: New Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Split 8 Change
Description: New Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Split 9 Change
Description: New Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Split 10 Change
Description: New Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Split 11 Change
Description: New Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Split 12 Change
Description: New Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Split 13 Change
Description: New Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Split 14 Change
Description: New Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Split 15 Change
Description: New Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Split 16 Change
Description: New Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Coord cycle state change
Description: Parameter is defined as: 1 = In Step, 2 = Transition - Add,3 = Transition - Subtract,4 = Transition - Dwell,5 = Local Zero,6 = Begin Pickup

Name: Unit Flash Status change
Description: See NTCIP 1202 2.4.5 for definition

Name: Unit Alarm 1 change
Description: Unit Alarm 1 set on/off

Name: Unit Alarm Group change
Description: Unit Alarm Group set on/off

Name: Special Function Output on
Description: Special function output as defined by the local controller.

Name: Special Function Output off
Description: Special function output as defined by the local controller.

Name: Interval Advance off/on
Description: leading edge on (1), lagging edge (0) optional

Name: Stop Time Input off/on
Description: Set when stop time input is applied or removed, regardless of source of stop

Name: Controller Clock Updated
Description: Set when the controller OS clock is adjusted via communications, OS command, or external input.
ParameterDescription: Optional parameter: Time correction in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Power Failure Detected
Description: Line voltage drops between 0-89 volts AC for more than 100 ms

Name: Ramp Meter - Power Restored
Description: Line voltage applied/reapplied greater than 98 volts AC

Name: Power Restored
Description: Line voltage applied/reapplied greater than 98 volts AC

Name: Recorded Split 1
Description: Actual Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Recorded Split 2
Description: Actual Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Recorded Split 3
Description: Actual Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Recorded Split 4
Description: Actual Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Recorded Split 5
Description: Actual Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Recorded Split 6
Description: Actual Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Recorded Split 7
Description: Actual Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Recorded Split 8
Description: Actual Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Recorded Split 9
Description: Actual Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Recorded Split 10
Description: Actual Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Recorded Split 11
Description: Actual Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Recorded Split 12
Description: Actual Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Recorded Split 13
Description: Actual Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Recorded Split 14
Description: Actual Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Recorded Split 15
Description: Actual Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Recorded Split 16
Description: Actual Split Time in Seconds (0-255)

Name: Actual Cycle Length
Description: Actual Cycle Time in Seconds

Name: Actual Natural Cycle Length
Description: Actual Natural Cycle Time in Seconds

Name: Actual Cycle Offset
Description: Actual Cycle Offset in Seconds

Name: Seq Change Request
Description: Sequence changed requested

Name: Master Cycle Zero
Description: Master Cycle Zero point

Name: Coord - Oversize Ped
Description: Oversized ped served in coord

Name: TSP Delay Time
Description: Tracks the time from TSP arrival to when TSP phase service begins.

Name: Time Drift (sec)
Description: Recorded controller time drift in seconds.

Name: Total Comm Attempts
Description: Total number of communication attempts in last period.

Name: Failed Comm Attempts
Description: Number of failed communication attempts in last period.

Name: Percent Comm Loss
Description: Percent of failed attempts in last period.

Name: Average Response Time (ms)
Description: The average response time of the status polling attempt over the last period.

Name: TSP Hold Time
Description: The amount of time the TSP request held the active phase past the programmed force off or max green time.

Name: TSP Early Term Time
Description: The amount time the TSP request terminated the active phase before the programmed force off or max green time.

Name: TSP Delay Begin
Description: Set when the TSP delay interval begins.

Name: TSP Delay End
Description: Set when the TSP delay interval begins.

Name: TSP Arrival
Description: Set when the TSP delay interval begins.

Name: Sequence Entry
Description: Set when a new sequence is started

Name: Pri/Pre Det Low On
Description: Set when pri/pre detector low call is received

Name: Pri/Pre Det Low Off
Description: Set when pri/pre detector low call is cleared

Name: Pri/Pre Det High On
Description: Set when pri/pre detector high call is received

Name: Pri/Pre Det High Off
Description: Set when pri/pre detector high call is cleared

Name: TSP Begin Service
Description: Set when a prioritor service is started.

Name: TSP Begin End
Description: Set when a prioritor service has ended.
